revised_title: Mismatch Repair Mechanisms in DNA and Tumor Development
tldr: The article discusses the role of mismatch repair in maintaining genetic stability and preventing tumor development. The authors describe the mechanism of methyl-directed mismatch excision repair in bacteria and its homologous system in human cells. They also explain how defects in the mismatch repair system can lead to increased mutability and a predisposition to tumor development in certain tissues.
